Privacy and safety of user information continue to be issues when it comes to Facebook. Eric Schmidt joked in a tweet that he was stepping away from his job as Google CEO because the company's

CEO Eric Schmidt Schimdt, Chairman of media company and web search giant Google has announced changes to the management team. The announcement came as a post to the Google Official Blog: When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined-even in my wildest dreams-that we would get as far, as fast as we have today. Search has quite literally changed people's lives-increasing the collective sum of the world's knowledge and revolutionizing advertising in the process. And our emerging businesses-display, Android, YouTube and Chrome-are on fire. Of course, like any successful organization we've had our fair share of good luck, but the entire team-now over 24,000 Googlers globally-deserves most of the credit, wrote Eric Schmidt . The change was made to simplify the company's management structure and speed up decision making. The decision was made over the holidays 2010.`` For the last 10 years,

Larry Page praised Eric Schmidt , too.`` There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly,'' Larry Page said. Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him The change in command overshadowed Google's fourth-quarter earnings, which soared past analysts' estimates as the company cranked up its Internet marketing machine during the holiday shopping season. . The BBC's political editor Nick Robinson said Mr Craig Oliver had no previous political involvement but had been approached by Mr Andy Coulson and had met the prime minister over the weekend. Mr Craig Oliver said: I'm delighted and privileged to be joining David Cameron and his team at such an exciting and challenging time.`` My background is broadcasting, but I know that newpapers play a crucial role and I look forward to talking with them.`` It's difficult to leave the BBC after working here for five fascinating years- but this is an opportunity I can't turn down.
